title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: Harry Potter, an eleven-year-old orphan, discovers that he is a wizard and is invited to study at Hogwarts. Even as he escapes a dreary life and enters a world of magic, he finds trouble awaiting him.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
description: A house elf warns Harry against returning to Hogwarts, but he decides to ignore it. When students and creatures at the school begin to get petrified, Harry finds himself surrounded in mystery.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
description: Harry Potter learns that Sirius Black has escaped from the prison of Azkaban and is planning to kill him. Meanwhile, Hagrid is distraught when his hippogriff, Buckbeak, is sentenced to death.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
description: In his fourth year at Hogwarts, Harry is unwittingly selected to compete in the inter-school Triwizard Tournament. Meanwhile, the wizarding world remains unaware of the ominous rise of dark forces.

title: Harry Potter and Order of the Phoenix
description: Harry Potter and Dumbledore's warning about the return of Lord Voldemort is not heeded by the wizard authorities who, in turn, look to undermine Dumbledore's authority at Hogwarts and discredit Harry.

title: Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince
description: Dumbledore and Harry Potter learn more about Voldemort's past and his rise to power. Meanwhile, Harry stumbles upon an old potions textbook belonging to a person calling himself the Half-Blood Prince.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
description: After Voldemort takes over the Ministry of Magic, Harry, Ron and Hermione are forced into hiding. They try to decipher the clues left to them by Dumbledore to find and destroy Voldemort's Horcruxes.

title: Airman
description: Airman, by Eoin Colfer, is a best-selling historical adventure novel set in the 19th century. It was released in the UK, Ireland and USA in January 2008. The novel was shortlisted for the 2009 Carnegie Medal. Colfer was inspired to write the book after a frightening skydiving experience.

title: On the Niemen
description: Nad Niemnem is a Positivist novel written by Eliza Orzeszkowa in 1888 during the foreign Partitions of Poland. Its main purpose was to present the Polish society and its own internal dynamics as they were in midâ€“19th century, in reference to the Polish January Uprising against the Russian occupation.
